page.title: 05SIBBERINGS FARM
page.content: { Sibberings Farm }is a 186 acre dairy farm. The present owners came to the farm in {1969.}They own 36 acres and rent the rest. They live on the farm with their three sons and work it themselves with the help of their eldest son who works before school and in the holidays. They {milk 83 cows}and get about{350 {gallons}of milk a day. The owner's brother sells the {green top milk.} About {65 galls.}are sold on the milk round and the rest is taken by the{ {Milk Marketing Board. The cows are a {Friesian Holstein {cross.}They all have a name. The {bull {calves }are sold at about 4 months but the {heifers }are kept and added to the herd. {Crops }grown are grass for silage and hay plus{20 acres of spring barley {
